title.narrative: COMMUNICATIONS, ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIPS - OTHER SOURCES

description.narrative: Comms, Advocacy, and Partnership: Â Staff have enhanced capacity to effectively communicate on child rights, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for childrenÂ

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Comms, Advocacy, and Partnership: Staff have enhanced capacity to effectively communicate on child rights

description.narrative: The CO ran several integrated campaigns in 2021, including one particularly successful linked to the 10th anniversary of South Sudan which highlighted the humanitarian crisis in the country. With the lifting of COVID-19 preventive measures the CO could receive international media missions again. A country wide advocacy plan with four priorities was adopted and implemented. The network of UNICEF Child Reporters has grown to maturity with children involved in more and more activities | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
